title: Queen 'our most modernising monarch ever' say 'aides' to Meghan and Harry's pals
text:

Royal aides have apparently hit back at claims that Meghan Markle and Prince Harry are 'single-handedly' modernising the monarchy.

One senior staffer said the Queen was the most modernising head of state in the royal family's history, according to a report.

They added that she and the Duke of Edinburgh had transformed the monarchy from a medieval institution into a modern one, it is claimed.

The comments were made in response to sources close to the Duke and Duchess of Sussex claiming they were dragging the family into the 21st century.

(Image: REUTERS)

(Image: David Fisher/REX)

A senior royal staffer told The Sun: "“The Queen, with the support of Prince Philip, turned it from a medieval organisation to a modern one.“

"They broadcast the coronation, did the first-ever reality series on TV, opened Buckingham Palace up to the public."

Friends of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex recently accused the royal family of not giving them the recognition they deserve.

Sources claimed the couple's advisers were incapable of “harnessing their value”.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

It followed a row over the couple’s comments in a TV documentary on Sunday, in which they spoke of their “struggle” with life in the public eye.

And it came as Meghan, 38, was seen on Tuesday night for the first time since her and Harry's ITV documentary aired, smiling as she attended the One Young World Summit opening ceremony at the Royal Albert Hall in London.

Max Foster, an anchor and royal correspondent for US news network CNN, said a source close to the Sussexes told him: “The institution around the royal family is full of people afraid of and inexperienced at how to best help harness and deploy the value of the royal couple who, they said, ‘have single-handedly modernised the monarchy’.”

The Mirror previously revealed that senior royals believed Harry and Meghan were “in a moment of crisis” after their candid comments aired on Sunday, in a documentary covering their recent tour.

(Image: Getty Images)

Harry, 35, has finally confirmed rumours of a rift with brother Prince William that palace aides had been at pains to deny.

Speaking to ITV news anchor Tom Bradby, who he has been friends with for nearly 20 years, he said: “Part of this role and part of this job and this family being under the pressure that it’s under inevitably, you know, stuff happens.

“But look, we’re brothers. We’re certainly on different paths at the moment but I will always be there for him and I know he’ll always be there for me.

“You know, we don’t see each other as much as we, as much as we used to because we’re so busy. But I love him dearly and, you know, the majority of the stuff is created out of nothing. Just as I said, as brothers, you have good days, you have bad days.”
description: One royal aide is said to have pointed out that the Queen broadcast her coronation and opened Buckingham Palace to the public
